intro: Symbolanthus pauciflorus, commonly known as the few-flowered symbolanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Symbolanthus pauciflorus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
